title: Which families in the US are considered political dynasties, and why? - Quora
tags: Political History of the United States of America
History of the United States of America
Politics of the United States of America

response.answer_text: There have been/are several, to name a few: Roosevelts – Teddy and FDR (distant cousins) have been Presidents, two of FDR’s sons have been elected to Congress.Kennedys – JFK and RFK both held high government positions, Edward (Teddy) was a long time Senator. Patrick (Teddy’s son) was a RI congressman.Clintons – This one is probably a little premature as the politicians have been limited to one generation (Bill – president; Hillary as Senator, Secretary of State and Democratic presidential nominee).Bushes – Father and son have been presidents. Grandfather (Prescott) was a senator. Son/brother (Jeb) was governor of Florida and ran for the Republican presidential nomination.Cuomos – father and son have been governors of New York.Daleys – father and son both have been mayors of Chicago

We don’t have political dynasties. There have been incidents when father and son have served as well as a few that involved additional family members. But nothing that remotely could be equated with dynastic rule.
